issue.body:
**What this PR does / why we need it**:

This PR attempts to adopt and test CAPI v1.3.0-beta.0 beta release in IPAM, more specifically, by following https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api/blob/v1.3.0-beta.0/docs/book/src/developer/providers/v1.2-to-v1.3.md:

-     bumps Go version to 1.19.X
-     upgrades Ginkgo to v2 (2.2.0) and Gomega to v1.20.1 and related changes
-     upgrades cert-manager to v1.10.0.

commits.message:
Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file

This change stops saving the OS_ prefixed variables to a file but keeps
them logged on stdout. The file is not consumed elsewhere, by either
this image or Ironic itself. Outputting to a container instance's
stdout allows some other log collector to save what may be helpful
debugging information about the Oslo configuration, and adding the:
`|| true` allows for #370's suggestion of `set -euxo pipefail` to work
in cases where the environment variables are not set and grep would
return non-zero.

Merge pull request #392 from jharmison-redhat/fix-undefined-variables

Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file

pull_request.title: Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file
pull_request.body:
Instead of logging `OS_`-prefixed environment variables to a file in `configure-ironic.sh`, simply log them to stdout. Oslo does not consume all `OS_`-prefixed variables, and nothing in this image or Ironic consumes the `ironic.extra` file.

Additionally, the addition of `|| true` to the line prevents the grep from returning non-zero in cases where there are no `OS_`-prefixed variables defined, and this would be particularly important if #370 were merged (it will need to be rebased and deconflicted from this).

For reference, downstream OKD images have `pipefail` set but the images have no `OS_`-prefixed variables set. They therefore cause a crashloop on the `metal3-ironic` container as documented in this downstream bug:
https://issues.redhat.com/projects/OCPBUGS/issues/OCPBUGS-2992

labels.name: kind/documentation
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to documentation.

labels.name: triage/accepted

issue.body:
We should adopt a releasing approach similar to that of CAPI and follow the well-known semantic versioning guidelines (see references below).

Besides this being a good practice, integration with the redesigned clusterctl will require that projects follow the above mentioned releasing strategy. A similar issue was created for capbm: https://github.com/metal3-io/cluster-api-provider-baremetal/issues/224

PR Tracking:
- [ ] Makefile updates for docker build and push, and release manifests generation: https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/pull/405
- [ ] #272

issue.title: Gosec complains when creating files with permission higher than 0600 and tests fail in the other case

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: Indicates an issue lacks a `triage/foo` label and requires one.

issue.body:
**What steps did you take and what happened:**
After moving `imageDownload` function to common.go `gosec` started complaining about creating file with permission higher than 0600 however if we created those files with 0600 permission the test will fail.

```
 [/home/prow/go/src/github.com/metal3-io/cluster-api-provider-metal3/test/e2e/common.go:106] - G306 (CWE-276): Expect WriteFile permissions to be 0600 or less (Confidence: HIGH, Severity: MEDIUM)
    105: 		md5sum := strings.Fields(string(output))[0]
  > 106: 		err = os.WriteFile(fmt.Sprintf("%s/%s.md5sum", ironicImageDir, rawImageName), []byte(md5sum), 0777)
    107: 		Expect(err).To(BeNil()) 

```
**What did you expect to happen:**
Changing permission for 0777 to 0600 and the tests pass

**Anything else you would like to add:**



**Environment:**

- Cluster-api version:
- Cluster-api-provider-metal3 version:
- Environment (metal3-dev-env or other):
- Kubernetes version: (use `kubectl version`):

/kind bug

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
**What this PR does / why we need it**:

This PR attempts to adopt and test CAPI v1.3.0-beta.0 beta release in IPAM, more specifically, by following https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api/blob/v1.3.0-beta.0/docs/book/src/developer/providers/v1.2-to-v1.3.md:

-     uplifts dependencies as per: https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api/blob/v1.3.0-beta.0/docs/book/src/developer/providers/v1.2-to-v1.3.md#dependencies
-     bumps Go version to 1.19.X
-     upgrades Ginkgo to v2 (2.2.0) and Gomega to v1.20.1 and related changes
-     upgrades cert-manager to v1.10.0.

commits.message:
Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file

This change stops saving the OS_ prefixed variables to a file but keeps
them logged on stdout. The file is not consumed elsewhere, by either
this image or Ironic itself. Outputting to a container instance's
stdout allows some other log collector to save what may be helpful
debugging information about the Oslo configuration, and adding the:
`|| true` allows for #370's suggestion of `set -euxo pipefail` to work
in cases where the environment variables are not set and grep would
return non-zero.

Merge pull request #392 from jharmison-redhat/fix-undefined-variables

Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file

pull_request.title: Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file
pull_request.body:
Instead of logging `OS_`-prefixed environment variables to a file in `configure-ironic.sh`, simply log them to stdout. Oslo does not consume all `OS_`-prefixed variables, and nothing in this image or Ironic consumes the `ironic.extra` file.

Additionally, the addition of `|| true` to the line prevents the grep from returning non-zero in cases where there are no `OS_`-prefixed variables defined, and this would be particularly important if #370 were merged (it will need to be rebased and deconflicted from this).

For reference, downstream OKD images have `pipefail` set but the images have no `OS_`-prefixed variables set. They therefore cause a crashloop on the `metal3-ironic` container as documented in this downstream bug:
https://issues.redhat.com/projects/OCPBUGS/issues/OCPBUGS-2992

issue.body:
**What steps did you take and what happened:**
After moving `imageDownload` function to common.go `gosec` started complaining about creating file with permission higher than 0600 however if we created those files with 0600 permission the test will fail.

```
 [/home/prow/go/src/github.com/metal3-io/cluster-api-provider-metal3/test/e2e/common.go:106] - G306 (CWE-276): Expect WriteFile permissions to be 0600 or less (Confidence: HIGH, Severity: MEDIUM)
    105: 		md5sum := strings.Fields(string(output))[0]
  > 106: 		err = os.WriteFile(fmt.Sprintf("%s/%s.md5sum", ironicImageDir, rawImageName), []byte(md5sum), 0777)
    107: 		Expect(err).To(BeNil()) 

```
**What did you expect to happen:**
Changing permission for 0777 to 0600 and the tests pass

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
**What this PR does / why we need it**:

This PR attempts to adopt and test CAPI v1.3.0-beta.0 beta release in IPAM, more specifically, by following https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api/blob/v1.3.0-beta.0/docs/book/src/developer/providers/v1.2-to-v1.3.md:

-     uplifts dependencies as per: https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api/blob/v1.3.0-beta.0/docs/book/src/developer/providers/v1.2-to-v1.3.md#dependencies
-     bumps Go version to 1.19.X
-     upgrades Ginkgo to v2 (2.2.0) and Gomega to v1.20.1 and related changes
-     upgrades cert-manager to v1.10.0.

commits.message:
Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file

This change stops saving the OS_ prefixed variables to a file but keeps
them logged on stdout. The file is not consumed elsewhere, by either
this image or Ironic itself. Outputting to a container instance's
stdout allows some other log collector to save what may be helpful
debugging information about the Oslo configuration, and adding the:
`|| true` allows for #370's suggestion of `set -euxo pipefail` to work
in cases where the environment variables are not set and grep would
return non-zero.

Merge pull request #392 from jharmison-redhat/fix-undefined-variables

Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file

pull_request.title: Don't log OS_ prefixed variables to a file
pull_request.body:
Instead of logging `OS_`-prefixed environment variables to a file in `configure-ironic.sh`, simply log them to stdout. Oslo does not consume all `OS_`-prefixed variables, and nothing in this image or Ironic consumes the `ironic.extra` file.

Additionally, the addition of `|| true` to the line prevents the grep from returning non-zero in cases where there are no `OS_`-prefixed variables defined, and this would be particularly important if #370 were merged (it will need to be rebased and deconflicted from this).

For reference, downstream OKD images have `pipefail` set but the images have no `OS_`-prefixed variables set. They therefore cause a crashloop on the `metal3-ironic` container as documented in this downstream bug:
https://issues.redhat.com/projects/OCPBUGS/issues/OCPBUGS-2992

issue.title: Define release guidelines for baremetal-operator and start publishing releases

labels.name: kind/documentation
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to documentation.

labels.name: triage/accepted
labels.description: Indicates an issue is ready to be actively worked on.

issue.body:
We should adopt a releasing approach similar to that of CAPI and follow the well-known semantic versioning guidelines (see references below).

Besides this being a good practice, integration with the redesigned clusterctl will require that projects follow the above mentioned releasing strategy. A similar issue was created for capbm: https://github.com/metal3-io/cluster-api-provider-baremetal/issues/224

PR Tracking:
- [ ] Makefile updates for docker build and push, and release manifests generation: https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/pull/405
- [ ] #272

issue.title: Gosec complains when creating files with permission higher than 0600 and tests fail in the other case

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: Indicates an issue lacks a `triage/foo` label and requires one.

issue.body:
**What steps did you take and what happened:**
After moving `imageDownload` function to common.go `gosec` started complaining about creating file with permission higher than 0600 however if we created those files with 0600 permission the test will fail.

```
 [/home/prow/go/src/github.com/metal3-io/cluster-api-provider-metal3/test/e2e/common.go:106] - G306 (CWE-276): Expect WriteFile permissions to be 0600 or less (Confidence: HIGH, Severity: MEDIUM)
    105: 		md5sum := strings.Fields(string(output))[0]
  > 106: 		err = os.WriteFile(fmt.Sprintf("%s/%s.md5sum", ironicImageDir, rawImageName), []byte(md5sum), 0777)
    107: 		Expect(err).To(BeNil()) 

```
**What did you expect to happen:**
Changing permission for 0777 to 0600 and the tests pass

**Anything else you would like to add:**



**Environment:**

- Cluster-api version:
- Cluster-api-provider-metal3 version:
- Environment (metal3-dev-env or other):
- Kubernetes version: (use `kubectl version`):

/kind bug
